greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = gcd(C(n,k), C(n,k-1)), n >= 1, 1 <= k <= n.
comment: Equivalently, table T(n,k) = gcd(n,k)*(n+k-1)!/(n!*k!) read by antidiagonals. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 19 2002
reference: H. Gupta, On a problem in parity, Indian J. Math., 11 (1969), 157-163. MR0260659
link: Muniru A Asiru, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275(Rows n=1..50,flattened)
H. Gupta, On a problem in parity, Indian J. Math., 11 (1969), 157-163. [Annotated scanned copy]
formula: a(2n, n) = n-th Catalan number; see A000108.
Also T(n, k) = gcd(C(n, k), C(n+1, k)).
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[Gcd(Binomial(n,k), Binomial(n,k-1)): k in [1..n]]: n in [1.. 15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Oct 25 2018
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
ext: Offset set to 1 by _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 21 2010
